title: HTML with CSS Integration
subject: HTML
learning_objectives: Three ways to add CSS (Inline, Internal, External)
theory:

common_mistakes.correction: If styles don't load, 99% of time the href path is wrong (e.g., css/style.css vs style.css).

interview_questions.question: What is the priority order of CSS?
interview_questions.answer: Inline Style > Internal/External (depending on order) > Browser Default. (Exceptions include !important).

interview_questions.question: What is the relation between HTML and CSS?
interview_questions.answer: HTML defines the DOM elements. CSS targets those elements via selectors (tag, class, id) to apply visual properties.

practice_problems.problem: Link a stylesheet named 'theme.css' located in a 'css' folder.

real_world_use_cases.description: Websites change themes (Dark/Light) just by swapping the linked CSS file or changing a class on the HTML body.

summary: HTML without CSS is ugly. The <link> tag allows you to attach external stylesheets, enabling you to control the look and feel of your entire website from a single file. This separation of concerns is the gold standard of web development.
